Topic.Title: Is The Coca-Cola Company about to plunge? I think I have figured it out

Topic.Title: For All The Dumb SPLIT Questions>

Message.Msg: So, what you are saying is that if I can time it correctly I can make 100% on my money in a day. If I buy just after the stock split for $40 and then can sell to someone that is not paying attention to the stop split for $80, then I make a fortune. Is there a way to put in these pre and post split order with my brokerage. I could use a 100% gain in a day. Also, if I don't sell before the split does it mean I own less of the company? Does a company do a stock split to dilute the existing shares and then give more money to the employees. That sucks.

Message.Title: A Real Stock Split
Message.Msg: Here is what Happens - - Early tomorrow morning when the brokerage employees get to work (an HOUR early) they take each share of stock and cut it in half - VIOLA this is a true stock split.. they then place both pices of each share you own back in the box and you have a stock split....
obama failed miserably. anyone is better, i'd vote for a mop and bucket named jorge before obama.
your fine wendy. i added another 150 shares around 78.80 myself. when your long term buying it honestly doesn't matter.

You think they might come in 2 hours early for a 3:1 split or would their manager make them work overtime? I think that would be 3 pieces of paper for every one piece. I think the paper companies are getting rich off these brokers, buying all this paper and cutting it up. I'm going back to snorting my crack now. LOL

Do they keep the paper in a lock box or is it just left out loose, next to the paper shredder? Or maybe they let an intern keep an eye on it? What happens if they don't cut the paper exactly in half? Will some people get short shares?? This is a huge job, what happens if their scissors get dull or broken? Oh I wish I never bought this paper and stayed in gold bullion........
You would think they would keep it in a lock box along with their crack. I'll ask my used car sales guy, this guy knows it all.
Of course if it is a 50 for one stock split they would simply use a shredder - makes sense to me!!!
